title: Energy in circuit - Delta U for e- in resistor R

content.question: The figure shows a circuit where a battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math> is connected to two resistors with the indicated resistances. An electron is initially located at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and then moves through one of the resistors. By how much does the electric potential energy of the electron-field system change as the electron moves through the resistor?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative one third lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>e</mi></mstyle><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>

<math alttext="negative two thirds lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>e</mi></mstyle><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>

<math alttext="negative lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>e</mi></mstyle><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>

<math alttext="negative 3 lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>e</mi></mstyle><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative one third lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>e</mi></mstyle><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
